pr_title: IGNITE-7623 Add async API to Java Thin Client

timeline.bodyText: By the way, do we ever need to leave an old method? I mean, IgniteClientFuture implementsFuture. Are the any cases that we can break by just changing return type to a child type?
timeline.author: isapego
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -55,9 +55,25 @@
      * @return A Future representing pending completion of the task.
      * @throws ClientException If task failed.
      * @see ComputeTask for information about task execution.
+     * @deprecated Use {@link #executeAsync2(String, Object)} instead.
+     * This method calls {@link #executeAsync2(String, Object)} internally, but returns a more limited
+     * Future interface.
      */
+    @Deprecated

replies.bodyText: As I understand, this still breaks binary compatibility, so we have to create a new method.
replies.author: ptupitsyn

timeline.bodyText: Do we need executeAsync at all?
timeline.author: isapego

replies.bodyText: See above, I think we do, because of binary compatibility.
replies.author: ptupitsyn

timeline.bodyText:
I think, only those operations that do not modify cache state should be retried or we can get unexpected results, if the operation was successfully performed, but we were unable to receive response.
Also, it is OK to retry if failure happens on send.
timeline.author: isapego

replies.bodyText: I agree, but this behavior is consistent with sync API, I don't think we should have different behavior for sync and async API.
replies.author: ptupitsyn

timeline.message: Implementing async methods - improve getAll performance - remove extra collection copy
Fix compute init future handling - retry on disconnect
Implementing retries for async ops - add async reliability test to the suite
Fix error handling when retrying async operations
Fix thin client query cursor: close the cursor using the original channel
Fix thin client query cursor: close the cursor using the original channel
Fix thin client query cursor: fix testQueryConsistencyOnFailover
Revert exception handling for sync operations
Fix completeExceptionally logic for async failover
Fix completeExceptionally logic for async failover - ReliabilityTestAsync passes
Disable testFailover for partition-aware reliability tests
Fixing addSuppressed logic for async retries
Fixing addSuppressed logic for async retries
Preserve exception stack traces when handling future results
Preserve exception stack traces when handling future results
Preserve exception stack traces when handling future results 2

timeline.bodyText:
Here in below.
The passage about atomicity (which is an important note) is placed at the end of the passage and the one can easily miss it IMO. May be it makes sense to reformat the first sentence to something like:

This is equivalent to performing the following operations as a single atomic action:

Not a mandatory change request though, just a comment
timeline.author: isapego

timeline.bodyText:
Is it null by default? Does it mean, user will get an exception in runtime if it uses continuation with no executor set?
Maybe, we should set some implementation here as a default value? I'm pretty much sure, it is going to be fine for the most users, at least at the beginning of the development.
timeline.author: isapego

replies.bodyText: This is a private property, please see public setter and getter, there is a detailed javadoc.
